conclusion: Use properties of light refraction in a prism and apply the law of refraction.
Identify given values: incident angle is 60 degrees, refractive index for red light is sqrt(3).
Use the law of refraction: sin(alpha)/sin(beta) = n, substitute known values.
Substitute values into the equation: (sqrt(3)/2)/sin(beta) = sqrt(3).
Determine angle between emergent light and incident light: beta - alpha = sin^(-1)(sqrt(3)/3) - 60 degrees.
Calculate the angle: beta - 60 degrees = sin^(-1)(sqrt(3)/3).
Approximate sin^(-1)(sqrt(3)/3) as 30 degrees, angle between emergent and incident light is 30 degrees.
Solve for beta: beta = 60 degrees + 30 degrees = 90 degrees.
Angle between emergent light and incident light is 90 degrees - 60 degrees = 30 degrees.
The angle between the emergent light and the incident light is 30 degrees.
